clusters.title: Campaign urges NHS to improve diagnosis of potentially life-threatening childbirth condition
clusters.neutral_headline: NHS to improve diagnosis of childbirth condition

items.title: Campaign urges NHS to improve diagnosis of potentially life-threatening childbirth condition
items.standfirst: Exclusive: Five hospitals failed to spot Amisha Adhia had placenta accreta before one obstetrician intervenedAfter five hospitals failed to spot that she had a rare but potentially fatal complication of childbirth, Amisha Adhia is to launch a campaign urging the NHS to do more to diagnose the condition and save lives.Pregnant women are at much greater risk of developing placenta accreta spectrum if they have already given birth by caesarean section or had IVF treatment. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: Five hospitals failed to spot Amisha Adhia had placenta accreta before one obstetrician intervenedAfter five hospitals failed to spot that she had a rare but potentially fatal complication of childbirth, Amisha Adhia is to launch a campaign urging the NHS to do more to diagnose the condition and save lives.Pregnant women are at much greater risk of developing placenta accreta spectrum if they have already given birth by caesarean section or had IVF treatment. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Placenta accreta spectrum is a rare childbirth complication
Five hospitals failed to diagnose Amisha Adhia's condition
Campaign launched to improve diagnosis and save lives
Pregnant women at risk after caesarean section or IVF

items.standfirst: Substances include chemicals that can cause cancer, neurodevelopmental problems and the feminisation of malesYou wear them at work, you wear them at play, you wear them to relax. You may even get sweaty in them at the gym.But an investigation into headphones has found every single pair tested contained substances hazardous to human health, including chemicals that can cause cancer, neurodevelopmental problems and the feminisation of males. items.title: UK shoppers warned over spread of harmful and illegal skin lightening kits
items.standfirst: Many products contain substances banned because of serious and sometimes irreversible health risks, says CTSIIllegal skin lightening products are being sold in an increasingly wide range of UK outlets, including butchers, specialist food shops and small grocery stores, trading standards officers have warned.The Chartered Trading Standards Institute (CTSI) is warning that many of the products contain substances that are banned because of the serious risks they pose to health, including skin damage, infections and pregnancy complications. Continue reading...

Skin damage and infections are possible risks

clusters.title: Brazilian butt lifts should be banned in UK amid ‘wild west’ industry, MPs say
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazilian butt lifts should be banned in UK

items.title: Brazilian butt lifts should be banned in UK amid ‘wild west’ industry, MPs say
items.standfirst: Lack of regulation leading to procedures being carried out in sheds, hotel rooms and public toilets, committee findsBrazilian butt lifts should be banned in the UK, MPs have said, as a report found a lack of regulation had led to a “wild west” of cosmetic procedures being carried out in garden sheds, hotel rooms and public toilets.The women and equalities committee (WEC) said high risk procedures such as non-surgical buttock augmentation should be outlawed immediately, and a licensing system for lower risk treatments was urgently needed. People with no training can carry out potentially harmful procedures, putting the public at risk, the group of MPs added. Continue reading...
items.content: Lack of regulation leading to procedures being carried out in sheds, hotel rooms and public toilets, committee findsBrazilian butt lifts should be banned in the UK, MPs have said, as a report found a lack of regulation had led to a “wild west” of cosmetic procedures being carried out in garden sheds, hotel rooms and public toilets.The women and equalities committee (WEC) said high risk procedures such as non-surgical buttock augmentation should be outlawed immediately, and a licensing system for lower risk treatments was urgently needed. People with no training can carry out potentially harmful procedures, putting the public at risk, the group of MPs added. Continue reading...

ai_summary: MPs call for ban on Brazilian butt lifts
Lack of regulation leads to unsafe procedures
Procedures carried out in unlicensed locations
Public at risk from unqualified practitioners
MPs demand ban on high-risk cosmetic procedures

clusters.title: Health support needed to tackle joblessness | Letter
clusters.neutral_headline: Health support needed to tackle joblessness

items.title: Health support needed to tackle joblessness | Letter
items.standfirst: Health-centred approaches that help individuals stay in or return to work are needed, says Nick PahlThe alarming rise in economic inactivity highlighted in your report (UK sleepwalking into joblessness epidemic, Tesco boss warns, 10 February) underlines a public health issue as much as an economic one. It is increasingly clear that millions of working-age people are drifting out of the labour market not through choice but because of long-term health problems and inadequate support systems around them.Tackling worklessness requires proactive, health-centred approaches that help individuals stay in or return to work. We also know that time out of work is corrosive. Good-quality work improves physical and mental wellbeing, providing income, social connection and purpose, and protects against social exclusion. Continue reading...
items.content: Health-centred approaches that help individuals stay in or return to work are needed, says Nick PahlThe alarming rise in economic inactivity highlighted in your report (UK sleepwalking into joblessness epidemic, Tesco boss warns, 10 February) underlines a public health issue as much as an economic one. It is increasingly clear that millions of working-age people are drifting out of the labour market not through choice but because of long-term health problems and inadequate support systems around them.Tackling worklessness requires proactive, health-centred approaches that help individuals stay in or return to work. We also know that time out of work is corrosive. Good-quality work improves physical and mental wellbeing, providing income, social connection and purpose, and protects against social exclusion. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Health-centred approaches aid in joblessness
Long-term health problems contribute to joblessness
Support systems needed to help individuals work
Good-quality work improves physical and mental health
Health-centred approaches to tackle economic inactivity

clusters.title: Should we really all be taking magnesium supplements? – podcast
clusters.neutral_headline: Should we really all be taking magnesium supplements

items.title: Should we really all be taking magnesium supplements? – podcast
items.standfirst: Testimonials about the beneficial health effects of magnesium supplements abound online, with influencers claiming that a daily pill can help with everything from anxiety to sleep and brain fog. But do any of these claims stack up?Ian Sample is joined by co-host Madeleine Finlay to find out where the science stands. They also hear from Katherine Tucker, the founder of the Center for Population Health at the University of Massachusetts Lowell. She explains what magnesium is doing in our bodies and the best approach we can take to ensure we are getting enoughSupport the Guardian: theguardian.com/sciencepod Continue reading...
items.content: Testimonials about the beneficial health effects of magnesium supplements abound online, with influencers claiming that a daily pill can help with everything from anxiety to sleep and brain fog. But do any of these claims stack up?Ian Sample is joined by co-host Madeleine Finlay to find out where the science stands. They also hear from Katherine Tucker, the founder of the Center for Population Health at the University of Massachusetts Lowell. She explains what magnesium is doing in our bodies and the best approach we can take to ensure we are getting enoughSupport the Guardian: theguardian.com/sciencepod Continue reading...

ai_summary: Magnesium supplements have various health claims
Testimonials claim magnesium helps with anxiety
Science stands on magnesium supplements is examined

Magnesium supplements are widely available online

clusters.title: NHS ’clearly failing’ to ensure children get measles vaccine, experts warn
clusters.neutral_headline: NHS ’clearly failing’ to ensure children get measles vaccine, experts warn

items.title: NHS ’clearly failing’ to ensure children get measles vaccine, experts warn
items.standfirst: Calls grow for reform of England’s vaccination system including delivery of jabs in pharmacies as take-up fallsChildren are at risk of measles because the NHS is “clearly failing” to ensure they get the MMR vaccine and its system needs an urgent overhaul, MPs and health experts have warned.Calls are growing for major reform of how MMR jabs are delivered as it emerged that vaccination rates in some parts of England are now on a par with those in Afghanistan and Malawi. Continue reading...
items.content: Calls grow for reform of England’s vaccination system including delivery of jabs in pharmacies as take-up fallsChildren are at risk of measles because the NHS is “clearly failing” to ensure they get the MMR vaccine and its system needs an urgent overhaul, MPs and health experts have warned.Calls are growing for major reform of how MMR jabs are delivered as it emerged that vaccination rates in some parts of England are now on a par with those in Afghanistan and Malawi. Continue reading...

ai_summary: NHS is failing to ensure children get MMR vaccine
Vaccination rates in England are falling
Experts call for reform of vaccination system
Delivery of jabs in pharmacies is proposed
Vaccination rates are compared to other countries
